channel.title: My first script

item.title: My first script
item.dc:creator: @dudeofthed dudeofthed
item.description:
@dudeofthed wrote:

[quote=“blakeman8192, post:3, topic:69478”]Thanks
I think I’m gona make a script that empties the recycle bin or something. Just gotta start small and master the small things because you can’t make big things without using small stuff.
As for now, I don’t understand how the colors and stuff work.[/quote]
Emptying the recycle bin is actually quite simple.
The only stuff you need to know is:
MoveMouse
ClickMouse
FindBitmap
If…Then
Procedures.

That is really all you need to know to make a script that can empty the recycle bin.

Good Luck with scripting,
From,
Dudeofthed.

item.title: My first script
item.dc:creator: @dudeofthed dudeofthed
item.description:
@dudeofthed wrote:

Pretty good work there for a first script. I could never make something like that. Good work.

I have re-formatted it for you so it is easier to understand and to edit it.

/////////////////////////////////////////////
//                                         //
//          Find the client                //
//          By Blakeman8192                //
//          And Formatted by:              //
//                           Dudeofthed    //
//                                         //
/////////////////////////////////////////////

program New;

var FindClient: Integer;  //Defining Things
//Completed Defining

procedure c;       //Clear the debug screen (easy shortcut, "c")
begin
  ClearDebug
end;

procedure clientfind;    //Finding Client procedure.
begin
  FindClient := 0; //Defines integer as 0.
  if (FindClient = 0) then
    ActivateClient //Client found
      c; //ClearDebug
  FindClient := 1; //Sets integer so it doesn't loop
  Writeln('Client Found') //Inform the user
end;

begin            //Beginning all procedures
  clientfind;    //Mostly found at bottom of S.C.A.R
end.

Read full topic

item.title: My first script
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

This script simply finds the client, I just made it all complicated.
Its my first one. I plan on getting really good with SCAR, I know java really well, so this was easy for me. It kinda looks formatted like java, so if it looks weird to you SCAR scripters out there, realize its my style of scripting with SCAR. Basically all it does is the “ActivateClient” procedure once, using an integer; then it clears the debug, I’ve set it up so it could be a long script, by making a procedure called “c” to clear debug, so I dont have to write ClearDebug every time, and I can just use “c;”, Then I made it use the Writeln method to say that the client has been found.
Thanks for the amazing tut, Driger. I wish someone made a tut for Java like that, I had to learn Java the hard way.
I hope I can get good, I guess I can think of this mini-script as a solid foundation for a huge script.
Please post and tell me what I could to to get better, thanks :)[br][size=1]Posted on: March 20, 2007, 09:09:35 PM[/size][hr]Heres the code if you guys don’t want to download:

[code]//Find the client
//By Blakeman8192

program New;
//Defining things
var FindClient: Integer;
//Done defining

//Clear the debug screen (easy shortcut, “c”)
procedure c;
begin
ClearDebug
end;

//Find the client procedure
procedure clientfind;
begin
FindClient := 0;//Defines integer as 0.
if(FindClient = 0)then
ActivateClient//Client found
c;//ClearDebug
FindClient := 1;//Sets integer so it doesn’t loop
Writeln (‘Client Found’)//Inform the user
end;

//Beginning all of the procedures
//Should always be at the bottom
begin
clientfind;
end.
[/code]
